org.ensembl.driver
Interface EnsemblDriver

All Known Subinterfaces:
ComparaDriver, CoreDriver, Driver, VariationDriver
public interface EnsemblDriver

An ensembl driver provides access to an ensembl database through it's adaptors.

Author:
Craig Melsopp

Method Detail

initialise

public void initialise(java.util.Properties configuration)
                throws ConfigurationException,
                       AdaptorException
Initialises the driver and it's adaptor with the configuration.

Parameters:
configuration - parameters specifying the database and any additional datasource specific settings.
Throws:
ConfigurationException
AdaptorException

getConfiguration

public java.util.Properties getConfiguration()
Returns:
configuration provided to initialise(Properties) plus any locally made modifications.
See Also:
initialise(Properties)

getAdaptor

public Adaptor getAdaptor(java.lang.String type)
                   throws AdaptorException
Returns:
Adaptor of the specified type, or null if no such driver available.
Throws:
AdaptorException

getAdaptors

public Adaptor[] getAdaptors()
                      throws AdaptorException
Returns:
array of zero or more Adaptors.
Throws:
AdaptorException

testConnection

public boolean testConnection()
Checks whether a connection can be made to the database. Useful for checking if a driver has been correctly configured. Note: This method might leave an open connection in a connection pool so you should call closeAllConnections() if you want to ensure all connections are closed.

Returns:
true if driver can connect to it's persistent store, otherwise false.
See Also:
closeAllConnections()

isConnected

public boolean isConnected()
Deprecated. Since ensj 30.3. Use testConnection() instead.

Checks whether a connection can be made to the database. Useful for checking if a driver has been correctly configured. Note: This method might leave an open connection in a connection pool so you should call closeAllConnections() if you want to ensure all connections are closed.

Returns:
true if driver can connect to it's persistent store, otherwise false.
See Also:
closeAllConnections()

fetchDatabaseNames

public java.lang.String[] fetchDatabaseNames()
                                      throws AdaptorException
Lists databases available on this server. This method does not require the database or database_prefix to specified in the configuration. This means that you can connect to a database server and retrieve the database names without having to first know one of them.

Returns:
zero or more database names available on the same server as this driver instance.
Throws:
AdaptorException

addAdaptor

public Adaptor addAdaptor(Adaptor adaptor)
                   throws AdaptorException
Attempts to connects to the database if not already connected. Useful for checking if a driver has been correctly configured.

Returns:
true if driver can connect to it's persistent store, otherwise false.
Throws:
AdaptorException

public void removeAdaptor(Adaptor adaptor)
                   throws AdaptorException
Throws:
AdaptorException

removeAdaptor

removeAllAdaptors

public void removeAllAdaptors()
                       throws AdaptorException
Throws:
AdaptorException

getConnection

public java.sql.Connection getConnection()
                                  throws AdaptorException
Throws:
AdaptorException

clearAllCaches

public void clearAllCaches()
                    throws AdaptorException
Clears all caches.

Throws:
AdaptorException - if a problem occurs closing the connections.

closeAllConnections

public void closeAllConnections()
                         throws AdaptorException
Closes all connections opened by the driver and it's adapotors.

Throws:
AdaptorException

getDatasource

public javax.sql.DataSource getDatasource()
                                   throws AdaptorException
Datasource this driver gets connections from.

Returns:
datasource this driver gets connections from.
Throws:
AdaptorException

getServerFactory

public ServerDriverFactory getServerFactory()
If two EnsemblDrivers wrap databases on the same database server then setting the same ServerDriverFactory on both will enable them to share connections.

Returns:
factory if set,otherwise null.

setServerDriverFactory

public void setServerDriverFactory(ServerDriverFactory cacheManager)
If two EnsemblDrivers wrap databases on the same database server then setting the same ServerDriverFactory on both will enable them to share connections.

fetchTableNames

public java.lang.String[] fetchTableNames()
                                   throws AdaptorException
Return list of database tables excluding backup tables. Calls fetchTableNames(false).

Returns:
all table names in associated database excluding backup tables.
Throws:
AdaptorException
See Also:
fetchTableNames(boolean)

fetchTableNames

public java.lang.String[] fetchTableNames(boolean includeBackups)
                                   throws AdaptorException
Returns list of tables in database with or without backup tables.

Parameters:
includeBackups - whether to include backup tables.
Returns:
zero or more table names.
Throws:
AdaptorException

backupTables

public void backupTables()
                  throws AdaptorException
Backup all tables returned by fetchTableNames(). Calls backup(String) for each table returned by fetchTableNames(). Note: this method might not work with all database servers, it has only been tested with MySQL.

Throws:
AdaptorException
See Also:
fetchTableNames(), backupTable(String)

backupTable

public void backupTable(java.lang.String tableName)
                 throws AdaptorException
Backup the table. Note: this method might not work with all database servers, it has only been tested with MySQL.

Parameters:
tableName - name of table to be backed up.
Throws:
AdaptorException

backupTables

public void backupTables(java.lang.String[] tableNames)
                  throws AdaptorException
Backup all the tableNames. Note: this method might not work with all database servers, it has only been tested with MySQL.

Parameters:
tableNames - tables to be backed up.
Throws:
AdaptorException

clearTables

public void clearTables()
                 throws AdaptorException
Clears all tables returned by fetchTableNames(); Note: this method might not work with all database servers, it has only been tested with MySQL. Calls clear(String) for all tables returned by fetchTableNames().

Throws:
AdaptorException

clearTable

public void clearTable(java.lang.String tableName)
                throws AdaptorException
Empties the table. Note: this method might not work with all database servers, it has only been tested with MySQL.

Parameters:
tableName - table name.
Throws:
AdaptorException

clearTables

public void clearTables(java.lang.String[] tableNames)
                 throws AdaptorException
Empties all the tables. Note: this method might not work with all database servers, it has only been tested with MySQL. Calls clear(String) for all tableNames.

Parameters:
tableNames - tables to to cleared.
Throws:
AdaptorException

backupAndClearTables

public void backupAndClearTables()
                          throws AdaptorException
Backs up and clears all tables returned by fetchTableNames(). Calls backupAndClear(String) for all tables returned by fetchTableNames(). Note: this method might not work with all database servers, it has only been tested with MySQL.

Throws:
AdaptorException
See Also:
fetchTableNames()

backupAndClearTable

public void backupAndClearTable(java.lang.String tableName)
                         throws AdaptorException
Make a backup copy of the table and empty the original table. Calls backup(tableName) and clear(tableName). Note: this method might not work with all database servers, it has only been tested with MySQL.

Parameters:
tableName - table to be backed up and cleared.
Throws:
AdaptorException

backupAndClearTables

public void backupAndClearTables(java.lang.String[] tableNames)
                          throws AdaptorException
Backup the tables and empty the originals. Note: this method might not work with all database servers, it has only been tested with MySQL.

Parameters:
tableNames - tables to be backed up and cleared.
Throws:
AdaptorException
See Also:
backupAndClearTable(String)

restoreTables

public void restoreTables()
                   throws AdaptorException
Restores all the tables returned by fetchTableNames(). that have backup copies. Calls restore(String) for each table. Note: this method might not work with all database servers, it has only been tested with MySQL.

Throws:
AdaptorException
See Also:
restoreTable(String)

restoreTable

public void restoreTable(java.lang.String tableName)
                  throws AdaptorException
Restores the table from a backup table. Restoring means copying the rows from the backup table into the table, replacing any original data.

Parameters:
tableName - table to be restored.
Throws:
AdaptorException

restoreTables

public void restoreTables(java.lang.String[] tableNames)
                   throws AdaptorException
Restores all the tables from their respective backups. Calls restore(String) for each table. Note: this method might not work with all database servers, it has only been tested with MySQL.

Parameters:
tableNames - tables to be restored.
Throws:
AdaptorException

deleteDatabase

public void deleteDatabase()
                    throws AdaptorException
Delete the database this driver wraps. Uses getConfiguration.getProperty("database") to determine the database name. Does nothing if it is null. Note: this method might not work with all database servers, it has only been tested with MySQL.

Throws:
AdaptorException
